name: apikeys
title: API Keys API
description: Manages the API keys associated with developer projects.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services
View your data across Google Cloud Platform services

Operation.description: This resource represents a long-running operation that is the result of a network API call.

name.description: The server-assigned name, which is only unique within the same service that originally returns it. If you use the default HTTP mapping, the `name` should be a resource name ending with `operations/{unique_id}`.

metadata.description: Service-specific metadata associated with the operation. It typically contains progress information and common metadata such as create time. Some services might not provide such metadata. Any method that returns a long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

additionalProperties.description: Properties of the object. Contains field @type with type URL.

done.description: If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress. If `true`, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is available.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

response.description: The normal response of the operation in case of success. If the original method returns no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is `google.protobuf.Empty`. If the original method is standard `Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the resource. For other methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where `Xxx` is the original method name. For example, if the original method name is `TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is `TakeSnapshotResponse`.

additionalProperties.description: Properties of the object. Contains field @type with type URL.

Status.description: The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of google.rpc.Code.

message.description: A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the google.rpc.Status.details field, or localized by the client.

details.description: A list of messages that carry the error details. There is a common set of message types for APIs to use.

additionalProperties.description: Properties of the object. Contains field @type with type URL.

V2alpha1ApiKey.description: The representation of an API key managed by the `ApiKeys` API. An API key is used for programmatic access to a project by a service account.

name.description: Output only. The resource name of the api key. Api key names have the form `projects/123/keys/abcd_123_dx`

displayName.description: Human-readable display name of this API key. Modifiable by user.

keyString.description: Output only. An encrypted and signed value held by this API key. This field will only be accessed through limited methods.

createTime.description: Output only. A timestamp identifying the time this API key was originally created.

creator.description: Email address of the user who originally created this API key.

updateTime.description: Output only. A timestamp identifying the time this API key was last updated.

state.description: Whether Key is active or deleted.
enumDescriptions: Default value indicates that the field is unset. It should never be used.
The key is in active state and can be used.
The key is marked as deleted. Deleted keys can be listed and undeleted within 30 days of deletion.

V2alpha1Restrictions.description: Restrictions for all types of API Keys.

browserKeyRestrictions.description: Key restrictions that are specific to browser keys. Referer

serverKeyRestrictions.description: Key restrictions that are specific to server keys. Allowed ips

androidKeyRestrictions.description: Key restriction that are specific to android keys. Android apps

iosKeyRestrictions.description: Key restriction that are specific to iOS keys. IOS app id

apiTargets.description: A restriction for a specific service and optionally one or multiple specific methods. Requests will be allowed if they match any of these restrictions. If no restrictions are specified, all targets are allowed.

V2alpha1BrowserKeyRestrictions.description: Key restrictions that are specific to browser keys.

allowedReferrers.description: A list of regular expressions for the referrer URLs that are allowed when making an API call with this key.

V2alpha1ServerKeyRestrictions.description: Key restrictions that are specific to server keys.

allowedIps.description: A list of the caller IP addresses that are allowed when making an API call with this key.

V2alpha1AndroidKeyRestrictions.description: Key restrictions that are specific to android keys.

allowedApplications.description: A list of Android applications that are allowed to make API calls with this key.

V2alpha1AndroidApplication.description: Identifier of an Android application for API key use.

sha1Fingerprint.description: The SHA1 fingerprint of the application. For example, both sha1 formats are acceptable as input: DA:39:A3:EE:5E:6B:4B:0D:32:55:BF:EF:95:60:18:90:AF:D8:07:09 or DA39A3EE5E6B4B0D3255BFEF95601890AFD80709. Output format is the latter.

packageName.description: The package name of the application.

V2alpha1IosKeyRestrictions.description: Key restrictions that are specific to iOS keys.

allowedBundleIds.description: A list of bundle IDs that are allowed when making API calls with this key.

V2alpha1ApiTarget.description: A restriction for a specific service and optionally one or multiple specific methods. Both fields are not case sensitive.

service.description: The service for this restriction. It should be canonical One Platform service name, for example: google.cloud.translate.v2.TranslateService.

methods.description: Optional. List of one or more methods that can be called. If empty, all methods for the service are allowed. A wildcard (*) can be used as the last symbol. Valid examples: google.cloud.translate.v2.TranslateService.GetSupportedLanguage TranslateText Get* google.cloud.translate.v2.TranslateService.Get*

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of results.

keyString.description: An encrypted and signed value of the key.

parent.description: The parent that owns the key with the value specified in the request.

name.description: The name of the operation resource.

get.description: Gets the latest state of a long-running operation. Clients can use this method to poll the operation result at intervals as recommended by the API service.

parent.description: Required. The project for which this API key will be created.

name.description: Required. The resource name of the Api key to be cloned under same parent. `apikeys.keys.get permission` and `apikeys.keys.create permission` are required for parent resource.

clone.description: Clones the existing key's restriction, display name to a new Api Key.

parent.description: Required. Lists all API keys associated with this project.

pageSize.description: Optional. Specifies the maximum number of results to be returned at a time.

pageToken.description: Optional. Requests a specific page of results.

filter.description: Optional. Only list keys that conform to the given filter. The allowed filter strings are `state:ACTIVE` and `state:DELETED`. By default, ListKeys will return active keys.

list.description: Lists the API keys owned by a project. Key string of ApiKey will not be set.

name.description: Required. The resource name of the API key to be retrieved.

get.description: Gets the metadata for an API key. Key string will not be set in the response.

name.description: Required. The resource name of the API key to be retrieved.

getKeyString.description: Get key string for an API key.

name.description: Required. The resource name of the API key to be modified.

updateMask.description: Required. The field mask specifies which fields should be updated as part of this request. All other fields will be ignored. Allowed field mask: `display_name` and `restrictions`

patch.description: Patches the modifiable fields of an API key. Key string will not be set in the ApiKey response of the long running operation.

name.description: Required. The resource name of the API key to be deleted.
Required. The resource name of the API key to be undeleted.

undelete.description: Undeletes an API key which was deleted within 30 days.

keyString.description: Required. Finds the project that owns the key string value.

getKeyStringName.description: Get parent and name of the Api Key which has the key string. Permission `apikeys.keys.getKeyStringName` is required on the parent.
